title: P-Shot® (PRP Shot for Men)
tagline: Rebuild Performance with Your Own Biology
description: Doctor-administered PRP injections that regenerate penile tissue, sensitivity, and blood flow.
longDescription: The P-Shot® is our signature regenerative procedure for men's sexual wellness. Using a concentrated dose of your own platelet-rich plasma (PRP), we stimulate new blood vessel growth, mobilise stem cells, and repair micro-tissue damage responsible for performance issues. The result is stronger, longer-lasting erections, increased girth, heightened sensitivity, and renewed confidence—all without implants or daily medication.

seo.metaTitle: P-Shot London | PRP Shot Treatment for Men | Dr. SNA Clinic
seo.metaDescription: Experience the P-Shot in London with Dr. SNA Clinic. £1,200 standard / £1,350 enhanced package. Doctor-led procedure, zero downtime, finance available.

hero.headline: London's Leading P-Shot Clinic
hero.subheadline: Doctor-led PRP injection that renews blood flow, sensation, and confidence

overview.title: What Is the P-Shot?
overview.content: Developed by Dr. Charles Runels, the P-Shot harnesses growth factors from your own blood to regenerate penile tissue. We draw a small sample, spin it in a medical-grade centrifuge, and extract platelet-rich plasma loaded with healing proteins. This PRP is injected with ultra-fine needles along the corpora cavernosa and glans to improve blood flow, nerve signalling, and erectile strength. Because it's autologous, there's virtually zero risk of allergic reaction.
highlights: Targets root causes, not just symptoms
Improves erection quality and staying power

whatToExpect.title: What to Expect on the Day of Your P-Shot Appointment
whatToExpect.subtitle: A Quick, Professional, and Comfortable Procedure
whatToExpect.description: The P-Shot treatment is performed as a quick outpatient procedure, allowing you to go home the same day.

steps.title: Preparation & Comfort
steps.description: On arrival, you'll be made comfortable on the treatment table. A numbing cream or ointment is applied to the genital area, including the penile shaft, to minimise discomfort during the procedure.

steps.title: Blood Collection
steps.description: A small blood sample is drawn, usually from your arm, using a sterile collection tube.

steps.title: PRP Processing
steps.description: The sample is placed in a centrifuge to separate and concentrate the platelet-rich plasma (PRP) from the rest of your blood.

steps.title: PRP Extraction
steps.description: The PRP is carefully extracted and prepared in syringes for precise injection.

steps.title: Targeted PRP Injections
steps.description: Using ultrasound-guided accuracy, the PRP is injected directly into the penile shaft and other targeted areas as needed. This process typically involves four to five small injections and takes only a few minutes.

steps.title: Post-Treatment Support
steps.description: If recommended, you will be given a penis pump to enhance blood flow and maximise the effects of the PRP. You'll receive clear instructions to use it safely (about 10 minutes daily for several weeks).

videoTestimonials.title: Real Patient Stories

testimonials.name: Patient Success Story 2
testimonials.quote: After trying various treatments, the P-Shot combined with shockwave therapy gave me the results I was looking for. Highly recommend Dr. SNA Clinic.

howItWorks.title: The Science Behind the P-Shot
howItWorks.subtitle: Growth factors that remodel tissue from the inside out
howItWorks.content: Platelets contain PDGF, VEGF, TGF-β, and EGF—signals that instruct your body to repair and regenerate. When injected into penile tissue, they stimulate angiogenesis (new vessels), activate stem cells, and repair micro-tears caused by ageing, diabetes, or medication use. The procedure also releases nitric oxide for improved arterial dilation.

faq.question: Does the P-Shot hurt?
faq.answer: Topical anaesthetic and vibration analgesia make the procedure very tolerable. Patients describe pressure rather than pain, lasting only minutes.

faq.question: When can I resume intimacy?
faq.answer: You can resume sexual activity immediately—many patients prefer to wait 24 hours due to mild swelling, but it's not medically required.

faq.question: Is it safe if I have diabetes or take medication?
faq.answer: Yes, provided glucose levels are controlled and blood thinners are reviewed. We'll adjust your plan or coordinate with your GP if needed.

faq.question: How many treatments will I need?
faq.answer: Most men achieve goals with a single treatment plus review. Severe ED or Peyronie's may benefit from a second session at 6 months.

faq.question: Can it replace PDE5 inhibitors?
faq.answer: Many patients reduce or eliminate pill use after the P-Shot. We can also integrate low-dose medication for hybrid protocols if desired.

faq.question: Any side effects?
faq.answer: Temporary fullness, warmth, or minor bruising may appear for 24-48 hours. Serious complications are extremely rare because PRP is autologous.
